headline.print_headline: Insurance Plan for Sickest Gets Another Extension
headline.main: Insurance Plan for Sickest Gets Another Extension

docs.snippet: Health insurance companies can no longer turn away people with medical problems, but the Obama administration isn't taking any chances with thousands of vulnerable patients in a special federal program....
docs.lead_paragraph: Health insurance companies can no longer turn away people with medical problems, but the Obama administration isn't taking any chances with thousands of vulnerable patients in a special federal program.

headline.sub: Despite boycotts, first day of voting in Egypt proceeds
headline.main: Despite boycotts, first day of voting in Egypt proceeds

docs.lead_paragraph: Egypt's first day of its constitutional referendum wraps up. Observers say the voting proceeded without major problems. Nathan Frandino reports.

headline.main: Dozens Reportedly Arrested in Nigeria Amid Antigay Crackdown

headline.print_headline: EU Reaches Deal on Sweeping Securities Reform
headline.main: EU Reaches Deal on Sweeping Securities Reform

docs.snippet: Curbs on commodity speculation and ultra-fast share trading will be introduced across the European Union (EU) under an agreement reached on Tuesday on a broad reform of securities markets....
docs.lead_paragraph: Curbs on commodity speculation and ultra-fast share trading will be introduced across the European Union (EU) under an agreement reached on Tuesday on a broad reform of securities markets.

headline.print_headline: U.S. Senate Panel to Criticize State Department Over Benghazi Response
headline.main: U.S. Senate Panel to Criticize State Department Over Benghazi Response

docs.snippet: A report by the Senate Intelligence Committee to be released on Wednesday was expected to criticize the State Department for inadequate security at the U.S. diplomatic post in Benghazi, Libya, when it suffered a deadly attack on September 11, 2012...

headline.print_headline: Teen Faces 3 Murder Counts in Indiana Fire
headline.main: Teen Faces 3 Murder Counts in Indiana Fire

docs.snippet: An Indiana house fire where three young siblings died and a fourth was badly burned began when a teenager fired a flare into the home in a property dispute with one of the residents, authorities said Tuesday....
docs.lead_paragraph: An Indiana house fire where three young siblings died and a fourth was badly burned began when a teenager fired a flare into the home in a property dispute with one of the residents, authorities said Tuesday.
